head.supplied: 10/10/68 ¶ Dear Dr Ellery ¶ ¶ Some time since I pointed out that Dr O. W. Sonder of Hamburg, the great collaborator of the late Prof Harvey, ¶ had for years been the means of effecting interchanges ...

div.p: MS 11663 Royal Society of Victoria records, box 2/2, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Some time since I pointed out that Dr O. W. Sonder of Hamburg, the great collaborator of the late Prof Harvey,
Harvey & Sonder (1859-65). had for years been the means of effecting interchanges for the Royal Society of Victoria, and that I thought it would have been a graceful token of respect if he was placed on the roll of the honorary members of the Society.
M's earlier proposal not found. The same request was simultaneously made by me to the Tasmanian Society by myself, which at once most gracefully responded to my suggestion.
Sonder was elected a Corresponding Member of the Royal Society of Tasmania on 14 April 1868.

This week again I had occasion to send some publications to the R. S. free of expenses, which contributions came again through Dr Sonder's care, and I must confess I feel some what hurt that the small recognition, which I desired for so excellent generous & learned a man, was hitherto — as far as I know — not conferred.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd von Mueller
MS annotation presumably by Ellery: 'Dated 10 Oct | Read 2 Nov | Ansd 3 Nov 1868 | Postponed till after election of New Council R. L. J. Ellery 2/11/68'. Ellery's letter not found, but see M to T. Rawlings, 3 November 1868 (in this edition as 68-11-03b). M's proposal was not taken up.
